channel.title: Javac is not recognized as an internal or external
channel.description:
could someone please help me??
` javac` is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. press any key to continue . . .

item.title: Javac is not recognized as an internal or external
item.dc:creator: @dy3p8ntrkid dy3p8ntrkid
item.description:
@dy3p8ntrkid wrote:

You have to take whatever you are using and put it in a JDK bin folder, here’s safe link from Sun.com if you want it, then download that and install it, it’ll be a couple minutes, then to find the bin folder, follow this

JDK Download: https://cds.sun.com/is-bin/INTERSHOP.enfinity/WFS/CDS-CDS_Developer-Site/en_US/-/USD/ViewProductDetail-Start?ProductRef=jdk-6u13-oth-JPR@CDS-CDS_Developer

My Computer>Program Files>Java>Jdk1.6.0_XX(xx being your version, it varies)>Bin… Inside this bin folder, put all source or client files, then try running your .Bat files, it should work, also make sure your .Bat files are set to the correct version number, make sure it looks exactly like the version your JDK folder is set to, for example if you downloaded from link it’ll be like this C:/MyComputer/ProgramFiles/Java/Jdk1.6.0_13/Bin/javac or something like that… Hopefully this helps.

Read full topic
item.source: Javac is not recognized as an internal or external
